Publications

Goodness of fit tests for random multigraph models

Termeh Shafie

Goodness of fit tests for different probability models for random multigraphs.
Jul 21, 2022

Multiplexity Analysis of Networks using Multigraph Representations

Termeh Shafie, David Schoch

Method for performing multiplexity analysis in networks with multiple node covariates.
Sep 30, 2021

Social Network Analysis

Termeh Shafie

A review chapter on social network analysis aimed towards undergraduate students.
Jun 17, 2020

A Framework for Reconstructing Archaeological Networks using Exponential Random Graph Models

Viviana Amati, Angus Mol, Termeh Shafie, Corinne Hofman, Ulrik Brandes

We present a general framework in which we combine exponential random graph models with archaeological substantiations of mechanisms that may be responsible for network formation to account for tie dependence.
Aug 25, 2019

Reconstructing Archaeological Networks with Structural Holes

Viviana Amati, Termeh Shafie, Ulrik Brandes

We consider exponential random graph models, and show how they can be applied to reconstruct networks coherent with Burt’s arguments on closure and structural holes (Burt 2001).
Mar 25, 2018

Random Multigraphs and Aggregated Triads with Fixed Degrees

Ove Frank, Termeh Shafie

New combinatorial results are given for the global probability distribution of edge multiplicities and its marginal local distributions of loops and edges. The number of multigraphs on triads is determined for arbitrary degrees, and aggregated triads are shown to be useful for analyzing regular and almost regular multigraphs.
Jan 25, 2018

Hypergraph Representations: A Study of Carib Attacks on Colonial Forces, 1509-1700

Termeh Shafie, David Schoch, Jimmy Mans, Corinne Hofman, Ulrik Brandes

We perform a centrality analysis of a directed hypergraph representing attacks by indigenous peoples from the Lesser Antilles on European colonial settlements, 1509-1700.
Oct 25, 2017

Investigating Human Geographic Origins using Dual-Isotope (87Sr/86Sr, d18O) Assignment approaches

Jason E Laffoon, Till F Sonnemann, Termeh Shafie, Corinne L Hofman, Ulrik Brandes, Gareth R Davies

Develop and test more standardized and quantitative approaches to geographic assignment of individual origins using isotopic data.
Feb 25, 2017

Analyzing Local and Global Properties of Multigraphs

Termeh Shafie

The local and global structures of undirected multigraphs under two random multigraph models are analyzed and compared.
Sep 25, 2016

Nation Building and Social Signaling in Southern Ontario AD 1350-1650

John P Hart, Termeh Shafie, Jennifer Birch, Susan Dermarkar, Ronald F Williamson

Social network analysis is used to demonstrates the signaling practices reflecting regional patterns.
May 25, 2016

Multivariate Entropy Analysis of Network Data

Over Frank, Termeh Shafie

Using multivariate entropies we show how it is possible to systematically check for tendencies in data that can be described as independencies or conditional independencies, or as dependencies allowing certain combinations of variables to predict other variables.
Jan 2, 2016

Data Protection for Online Social Networks and P-Stability for Graphs

Vicenç Torra, Termeh Shafie, Julián Salas

We consider different approaches for data privacy in online social networks and for developing graph protection.
Jan 1, 2016

A Multigraph Approach to Social Network Analysis

Termeh Shafie

The main purpose of this article is to show the versatility of a multigraph approach when analyzing social networks.
Jun 1, 2015

Complexity of Families of Multigraphs

Ove Frank, Termeh Shafie

Complexity measured for multigraphs are specified and their applicability is discussed.
Dec 1, 2012
